4.14.19  11:16 am   when i'm writing music i find it difficult to know what kind of section I just wrote (verse, chorus, bridge for example).

     keep an open mind. those terms can fool you, and the only thing that really matters is what happens and when

      However, when i listen to a song, i can easily hear which section is which and what would make sense to come next. Do you have any advice for me?

     apply that strategy to your own songs

     i am unclear as to whether you want to do it or not

4.13.19  11:58 pm   help bill I'm nervous because I'm applying to a college I really really want to get into but I'm sorta struggling to do the application because I'm really anxious that I won't get in without a perfect application, and I don't want to screw this up. How to not screw this up/not be nervous about it and just do my best?

     i'm not sure

4.13.19  9:55 pm   What are some cool ways to harmonize a melody?

     on 'old macdonald had a farm', let's say it's in C, you could add "f f e" notes above "had a farm" (a sixth up, in the key). Also on "happy birthday", on the last line ('happy birthday to you'), again let's say it's in C, you could put these notes under the melody: happy(Ab), birth(G), day(F#), to(F), you(E)

4.13.19  9:30 pm   What would you do if you had to go to school, and that was all fine and good until you remembered halfway through that everything it taught was simply one restricting form of looking at the immense and barely-understood-by-humans conglomeration of information that is the universe and in a matter of centuries that narrow perspective on the universe would be completely abandoned for a revised and equally narrow perspective and the only things that would maybe still mean anything are things like love and life and books that can't be quantified or explicitly understood but somehow are more than the sum of their parts and besides your existence and what you choose to do with it doesn't really matter in the grand scheme of things and you want to go and work on these things that will matter centuries from now, whether or not it will be eventually recognized by humanity, but currently those things are not materially rewarded by society and so you may be starved, incarcerated, ostracized, or broke because of doing those things which is fine I guess but then you accidentally let it get to you and become very angry and bitter at humans for not setting up their society to reward doing things that matter which impacts both your ability to do things that matter and also go to school?

     start watching a bunch of conspiracy videos i suppose

4.13.19  7:56 pm   Hey bill. I've asked a few questions before about making music (and you've helped a lot!!) but now comes the time to think about releasing my EP. I'd do it, but with the company I'm using, I have to pay 50 dollars to go through with it. Has this happened to you? And should I save up to do it?

     i prefer the ones that allow unlimited releases, and you just pay per year or something. that would be better if you want to release a lot of material
